meanings.definition: The state of being tight or closely packed together.
meanings.sent1: The tightness of the rope made it difficult to untie.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the tightness of the jar lid as I tried to open it.
meanings.sent3: The tightness of my shoes made me dance awkwardly.
meanings.sent4: The tightness of the traffic jam caused frustration among drivers.
meanings.sent5: The tightness of the hug from my friend warmed my heart.

meanings.definition: The quality of being securely fixed in place.
meanings.sent1: The tightness of the screws ensured the shelf wouldn't fall.
meanings.sent2: The tightness of the lock kept the door closed.
meanings.sent3: The tightness of the knot was so strong, even Superman couldn't untie it.
meanings.sent4: The tightness of the grip on the handle made her feel safe.
meanings.sent5: The tightness of the seatbelt saved his life in the accident.

meanings.definition: The feeling of tension or constriction in a physical object or body part.
meanings.sent1: The tightness in my chest made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: The tightness in my muscles after the workout was a good sign of progress.
meanings.sent3: The tightness in the balloon made it pop unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The tightness in her voice revealed her nervousness.
meanings.sent5: The tightness in the jar lid indicated it was sealed tightly.
